data.headline: S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed their worst week since November, pressured by AI-bubble fears and megacap tech rotation.
bullets: Friday saw a volatile but slightly positive close, though tech remains under pressure from job-loss worries and Cisco margin concerns.
Pre-IPO cash-outs at OpenAI and Anthropic, highlighted by WSJ, are adding to negative tech sentiment.
Treasury curve signals recession risk, but softer CPI and lower yields have boosted Fed rate-cut expectations and soft-landing hopes.
Amazon Ring ended its Flock Safety partnership amid privacy backlash, the main US corporate headline over the weekend.
China's recent bull run stalled on weak earnings expectations, with Asian markets mixed and Europe modestly lower despite ECB liquidity support.
US multinationals with China exposure could face pressure when trading resumes Tuesday as global flows remain cautious.
Key earnings to watch this week include Medtronic, Energy Transfer, Vulcan Materials, DTE Energy, Labcorp, Sonoco, Otter Tail, Tennant, Walmart, DoorDash, and eBay.
Early-week US data is light, with Empire State manufacturing and NAHB housing gauges ahead, while late-week GDP and income/outlays could reset the rates and growth narrative.
Industrials and energy sectors continue to lead year-to-date, holding gains despite tech and financial sector softness.
